meanings.definition: (verb) To allow liquid or gas to escape through a hole or crack.
meanings.sent1: The water bottle started to leak after I accidentally dropped it.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to leak any information about the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The faucet decided to leak water all night, creating a mini indoor waterfall.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to leak tears of joy as she hugged her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The balloon began to leak helium, slowly descending to the ground.

meanings.definition: (noun) An unintended hole or crack that allows liquid or gas to escape.
meanings.sent1: There was a leak in the roof, causing water to drip into the living room.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the leak under the sink to stop the water from spilling out.
meanings.sent3: The detective followed the leak of clues that led to the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The leak in the boat threatened to sink it during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The leak in the gas pipe was a serious safety hazard.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Allowing liquid or gas to escape through a hole or crack.
meanings.sent1: The leaky faucet wasted a lot of water every day.
meanings.sent2: The leaky roof caused water damage to the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The leaky balloon slowly lost its helium, floating closer to the ground.
meanings.sent4: The leaky tire needed to be patched up before it went completely flat.
meanings.sent5: The leaky pipe made a dripping sound that echoed in the empty house.
